snippet: On Tuesday two environmental groups filed suit against the town of Sanford, N.Y., alleging that it was violating residents’ free speech rights.
abstract: Two environmental groups are suing town of Sanford, NY,  for violating residents' free speech rights over resolution that bars any more discussion of gas drilling at town monthly board meetings because issue takes up too much time; case is rare instance where officials have actively sought renewed gas drilling, including hydraulic fracturing.
lead_paragraph: On Tuesday two environmental groups filed suit against the town of Sanford, N.Y., alleging that it was violating residents’ free speech rights.

headline.seo: Sanford, N.Y., Is Sued for Muting Debate on Hydraulic Fracturing
headline.main: Town Sued After Barring Debate on Gas Extraction at Meetings
headline.print_headline: Town Sued After Barring Debate on Gas Extraction at Public Meetings
